FacilityName: City of Tracy John Jones Water Treatment Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Facility. The City of Tracy, John Jones Water Treatment Plant (JJWTP) relies on the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.119 Process Safety Management Standard, the OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38 Emergency Action Plans, and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) 40 CFR Part 68 Chemical Accident Prevention Program, Risk Management Plan to guide in the establishment of policies for the efforts and commitment to prevent accidental releases of highly hazardous materials through prevention and emergency response.



Facility and Regulated Substances Handled. The City of Tracy, John Jones Water Treatment Plant (JJWTP) handles chlorine. The chlorine is handled in a 20 ton storage tank. The storage tank is located at the JJWTP facility location is a secured building that is connected to the emergency scrubber system.  The chlorine and scrubber system were installed during plant expansion in 2006 and are fully maintained.  



The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps. The City of Tracy, John Jones Water Treatment Plant generally follows the EPA 40 CFR Part 68 and OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 regulations for conducting process hazards analysis, as well as the OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 regulations for conducting compliance audits in the efforts of accidental release prevention. 



The Five-Year Accident History. There have been no accidental releases of chlorine within the last 5 years.



The Emergency Response Program. The City of Tracy, John Jones Water Treatment Plan has an emergency action plan generally following the regulations in OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety. The City of Tracy, John Jones Water Treatment Plant is currently addressing recommendations from the Process Hazard Analysis and recommendations from the Compliance Audit.
